user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysconf_:
```c
static int
mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysconf_ (void)
{
  int ret = -1;
#if defined(HAVE_SYSCONF) && \
  (defined(HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN) || defined(HAS_DECL__SC_NPROC_ONLN))
  long value = -1;
#ifdef HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN
  if (0 >= value)
    value = sysconf (_SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN);
#endif /* HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN */
#ifdef HAS_DECL__SC_NPROC_ONLN
  if (0 >= value)
    value = sysconf (_SC_NPROC_ONLN);
#endif /* HAS_DECL__SC_NPROC_ONLN */
  if (0 >= value)
    return -1;
  ret = (int) value;
  if ((long) ret != value)
    return -1; /* Overflow */
#endif /* HAVE_SYSCONF &&
          (HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN || HAS_DECL__SC_NPROC_ONLN) */
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#if defined(HAVE_SYSCONF) && \
  (defined(HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN) || defined(HAS_DECL__SC_NPROC_ONLN))
  long value = -1;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in general: the declaration and the guarded code are under a preprocessor conditional and so are only present in builds where HAVE_SYSCONF and at least one of the HAS_DECL macros is defined. They are not intrinsically unreachable. (A concrete violation could occur in a particular build if, for example, both HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN and HAS_DECL__SC_NPROC_ONLN are defined and sysconf(_SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN) is guaranteed to return a positive value — then the second guarded assignment (inside HAS_DECL__SC_NPROC_ONLN) would never be executed and thus would be unreachable in that build.)
